p: Respiratory viral infections are predominantly transmitted through infected droplets. Following general hygienic practices helps to decrease transmission. These include regular hand hygiene, minimizing contact with sick individuals, and avoiding the sharing of personal items. Following “ cough etiquette,” including covering the nose and mouth with a tissue while coughing, proper disposal of tissue, and prompt hand washing, is also shown to decrease spread of respiratory infections [ 47]. Currently, an effective vaccine is available only for influenza. Other measures of prevention include antivirals for close contacts of those with influenza and use of palivizumab, a monoclonal antibody, in high-risk individuals to prevent respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infections.
